title: Is This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Transportation Stock the Ultimate Threat to Tesla's Autonomous Ambitions?
text: Electric vehicle (EV) and robotaxi company Tesla (TSLA -8.09%) and its CEO, Elon Musk, have had a volatile year, with Musk often finding himself under a controversial spotlight and investors and analysts torn on Tesla's future. On one hand, the company has tremendous potential with all of its future initiatives, but on the other hand it trades at a meteoric valuation.

title: Tesla's earnings call left more questions than answers on robotaxi
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk made more bold projections for robotaxi's expansion plans in the US. Investors, however, didn't get much insight into how the pilot launch was going in Austin.

title: Tesla Q2: Stick The Pedal To The Metal
text: Tesla, Inc. stock is "uncommon amongst the uncommon." Autonomy growth in Fiscal 2027 validates the current valuation and sets the stage for a 50% 18-month return. I'm bullish, but not ignorant of near-term headwinds. CEO Elon Musk himself has stated that the next few quarters could be tough. Downside volatility should be capitalized on by investors. Musk's neutrality (not disengagement) politically is arguably Tesla's biggest near-term and long-term sentiment asset right now, if it can be achieved and sustained gracefully.

title: TSLA "Lagging" EV Story, GOOGL's "Long-Term Bets," Mag 7 "Domino Effect"
text: Daniel Newman joins Diane King Hall at the NYSE set to talk about the Mag 7 after Alphabet (GOOGL) and Tesla (TSLA) showed mixed results. He doesn't see Tesla moving to the downside long-term even as EV sales plunge.

title: Stock Market Today: Tesla Slumps 8.2% After Earnings, Musk Signals Rough Quarters
text: Tesla (TSLA -8.09%) closed down 8.2% at $305.30 on Thursday, retreating sharply after CEO Elon Musk's cautionary earnings commentary about "rough quarters ahead" amid macroeconomic and electric vehicle (EV) demand uncertainties.

title: Take a look at Tesla's 'retro-futuristic' diner and Supercharging station
text: Elon Musk's flagship Tesla Diner opened Monday in Hollywood, California, and the CEO is already eyeing expansion. CNBC's Katie Koontz got a look inside the California drive-in, which has 80 charging stations, two giant megascreens and classic American diner food.

title: Tesla is a company entering, 'a golden age,' Wedbush's Dan Ives says
text: Dan Ives, managing director and equity analyst at Wedbush Securities, joins Market Catalysts with Julie Hyman to discuss Tesla (TSLA) in light of the company's earnings miss. Ives says Tesla will lead in autonomous technology and robotics, but faces potential distractions ahead.

title: What Will Tesla's Lower-Cost Model Look Like?
text: On Tesla's earnings call, Truist Analyst William Stein was unable to get an answer about the design for the company's new lower-cost EV. Stein explains why that matters and reacts to Elon Musk's warning of a few “rough quarters ahead” on “Bloomberg Tech.

title: Tesla bull Dan Ives on why he's still betting on the stock, Trump to tour Federal Reserve renovation
text: Market Catalysts anchor Julie Hyman breaks down the latest July 24, 2025, market news. Wedbush's Dan Ives speaks with Julie about why he is still bullish on Tesla despite disappointing second quarter earnings.

title: "A Lot of Questions" Left After TSLA Earnings, Autonomous & EV Headwinds Ahead
text: Tesla (TSLA) sold off after missing earnings for the second quarter in a row. Elon Musk himself said "we probably could have a few rough quarters.

title: Google thrives, Tesla dives in Q2
text: Daniel Newman, CEO of The Futurum Group, digs into each company's Q2 earnings. Subscribe | http://t.st/TheStreetTV Earn.

title: Tesla's Q2 Earnings: Elon Musk's Candor Locks In Fate Of Fading Autonomy Premium
text: It's evident Tesla, Inc.'s thematic momentum underpinned by its autonomy ambitions is rapidly fading, as investor focus returns to the protracted slump across its existing auto business. CEO Elon Musk's discussion about Tesla's anticipated tariff impact to near-term growth and earnings also marks a stark 360-reversal of previous confidence that the company is well mitigated against them. Taken together, we expect TSLA stock to experience range-bound volatility in the $300-range following the post-earnings pullback.

title: Trump says he wants Musk to ‘thrive' as Tesla stock plunges
text: President Donald Trump took to social media Thursday morning to support Elon Musk's car company, a startling development given their bitter public feud.

title: Tesla Stock Crashed Today. Why Elon Musk Thinks It's Time to Buy.
text: Investors knew electric vehicle (EV) sales have been slumping for Tesla (TSLA -8.81%). The EV leader announced a 13.5% year-over-year drop in second-quarter deliveries on July 2.

title: Tesla CEO Musk warns of rough quarters ahead, Wedbush remains bullish on AI vision
text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares moved almost 10% lower following the automaker's second quarter earnings report as CEO Elon Musk warned the company could face “a rough few quarters ahead.” The company is facing several challenges, including the loss of the US federal EV tax credit, rising competition, tariff costs and Musk's political activities, which has alienated some of its customer base.

title: Calling Tesla a car company is overrated, says Fitz-Gerald Group's Keith Fitz-Gerald
text: Keith Fitz-Gerald, Fitz-Gerald Group principal, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss why he's bullish on Tesla, competition from China and his read on 'Big Tech'.

title: Tesla Q2 Earnings Surpass Expectations, Revenues Decline Y/Y
text: TSLA beats Q2 EPS estimates despite a 12% revenue drop, falling deliveries, and weaker automotive margins.

title: Musk Tells Tesla Investors to Focus on a Future Filled With Robots
text: Tesla points out early progress on robotaxis and bots, as revenue from electric vehicles plummets.

title: Musk's Warning Could Spoil Tesla's Buy-The-Dip Moment
text: Tesla Inc TSLA just delivered one of its toughest earnings in years. Second quarter revenue dropped 12% to $22.5 billion, and net income plunged 16%, while vehicle deliveries fell 13.5% year-over-year.

title: Tesla Stock Faces 'Critical Milestone' Ahead: Here's What Analysts Are Flagging As Next Key Catalyst
text: Can Tesla Inc‘s TSLA audacious bet on autonomy and AI outmaneuver mounting market headwinds? As analysts hold their ground despite disappointing earnings, the electric vehicle giant faces a pivotal moment that could redefine its future trajectory.

title: Trump To Visit Fed – A First For A President In 20 Years; Tough Road Ahead For Tesla
text: To gain an edge, this is what you need to know today.

title: Tesla ETFs: What's Next After Worst Q2 in a Decade?
text: TSLA posts worst quarterly revenue drop in over a decade, raising red flags for top Tesla-heavy ETFs like TESL, XLY, FDIS and VCR.

title: Tesla stock sinks following Q2 earnings, Trump warns of 15 to 50% tariffs
text: Morning Brief anchor Julie Hyman breaks down the latest market news for July 24, 2025. Tesla shares are falling after issuing a disappointing Q2 report.

title: Alphabet and Tesla earnings analysis, Keurig Dr Pepper earnings tops estimates
text: Alphabet "crushed it," Gradient Investment analyst Lisa Schreiber said when discussing Alphabet's second quarter earnings report with Brian Sozzi. Troy Gayeski, Chief Market Strategist for Future Standard, also joined the conversation to discuss the earnings report.

title: Canaccord Genuity's Gianarikas: We may have seen the bottom for Tesla, positive acceleration to come
text: George Gianarikas, Canaccord Genuity analyst, joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss outlooks on Tesla after CEO Elon Musk warned investors of a choppy period ahead, why he maintains his buy rating and anticipates positive acceleration beyond the next few quarters, and more.

title: Tesla's terrible quarter hasn't stopped analysts dreaming big about its robot future
text: Tesla's latest earnings were brutal, but investors and analysts aren't sounding the alarm just yet. Despite revenue falling and warnings of a "rough" road, Tesla bulls are focusing on its robotaxi plans.

title: Here's why Tesla stock is crashing today
text: Tesla's (NASDAQ: TSLA) second-quarter earnings report has revealed a broad decline in performance and global market share.

title: Tesla stock plunges as Elon Musk warns company may face ‘a few rough quarters' ahead
text: Tesla shares plunged as much as 10% in early trading Thursday as investors digested another dismal quarter of car sales – and CEO Elon Musk's admission that slump may not end anytime soon.

title: GOOGL Gains & TSLA Slides: Mag 7 Earnings Paint Different Pictures
text: The first round of Mag 7 earnings showed highs and lows after hours on Wednesday. Alphabet (GOOGL) rallied after posting an earnings beat and continuing momentum toward A.I.

title: US and the EU may be nearing a trade deal, Tesla misses expectations
text: Morning Brief: Market Sunrise anchor Ramzan Karmali breaks down the latest international market news for July 24, 2025. According to a report in the Financial Times, the United States and the European Union are closing in on a trade deal.

title: TSLA stock tanks 8%: what analysts think of Tesla's Q2 numbers
text: Tesla's stock crashed over 8% early on Thursday. The EV major has been dealing with several challenges over the past year.

title: Dow Tumbles 300 Points; Tesla Posts Downbeat Q2 Results
text: U.S. stocks traded mixed this morning, with the Dow Jones index falling more than 300 points on Thursday.

title: Tesla Has Talent But Needs Stability: Westly (Correct)
text: Steve Westly, Founder and Managing Partner, The Westly Group, and Former Tesla Executive, says Tesla needs to get its top executives in place and new products to market. The company needs a next-generation product with a "wow" factor to return to its former position.

title: Tesla Just Hit a Fork in the Road—Could the Bulls Lose Control?
text: Shares of Tesla Inc. NASDAQ: TSLA had been grinding higher into Wednesday night's earnings, up nearly 15% over the past two weeks and more than 50% since April. That kind of run can easily put investors on edge, as they know a lot is going to be riding on the company's next earnings report.

title: Sunrun ($RUN) | Tesla ($TSLA) | QuantumScape ($QS) | HIVE Digital ($HIVE) | Spire Global ($SPIR)
text: Welcome to the Green Stock News brief for Thursday July 24th. Here are today's top headlines: Sunrun (NASDAQ: RUN) has partnered with Tesla Electric (NASDAQ: TSLA) to launch a new home energy plan exclusively for Sunrun Flex customers in Texas, offering optimized solar production, battery backup, and energy independence.

title: Tesla second-quarter earnings: The key takeaways
text: CNBC's Arjun Kharpal breaks down Tesla' second-quarter earnings, including the company's commentary around a new affordable model, robotics and future demand.

title: Tesla Q2: A Poor Quarter Is The Least Of Investors' Concerns
text: Tesla, Inc. has underperformed the S&P 500 on an absolute basis, while also experiencing significant volatility. The exciting narrative is running out of steam, which is resulting in lower momentum exposure for the stock. TSLA is no longer a high-growth stock but does not achieve margins akin to a mature company.

title: Nasdaq 100: Alphabet's Surge Offsets Tesla Slide, While IBM Pulls Dow Jones Lower
text: Alphabet's earnings beat lifts tech stocks, boosting the Nasdaq 100, while IBM drags down the Dow. US indices diverge as investors weigh mixed results.

title: Tesla's 'iPhone' Moment Is Here
text: Recent earnings beat revenue estimates, with improving gross margins and reduced reliance on tax credits, supporting future profitability and growth prospects. Tesla's ecosystem, data advantage, and innovation in robotaxis and humanoid robots could unlock massive new revenue streams, echoing Apple's iPhone moment. Risks include competition, political factors, FSD uncertainty, and other variables, but my 2030 bullish case price target range remains $2,500–$3,000.

title: Tesla stock price falls again: 3 factors weighing Elon Musk's EV maker down
text: Investors in Tesla can't seem to catch a break. Yesterday, Elon Musk's electric vehicle company reported its Q2 2025 results—and they weren't good.

title: Why Tesla analysts are mostly upbeat about earnings, but investors aren't happy
text: Analysts were mostly upbeat about Tesla's earnings, even as investors worried about CEO Elon Musk's comments about potential “rough” quarters ahead.

title: Sell Tesla Bubble: Walls Closing In Post Q2 Earnings
text: Tesla, Inc.'s core auto business is stagnating, with negative YoY growth and flat revenue per share since mid-2023, undermining its trillion-dollar valuation. Aspirational segments like autonomous driving and humanoid robots are highly competitive, with no clear TSLA advantage. TSLA's sky-high P/E and reliance on optimistic forecasts are unsustainable; future earnings reports are unlikely to justify the current valuation.

title: Tesla: No Margin Meltdown, Strong Buy
text: Tesla's Q2 deliveries fell 13% Y/Y in Q2, but I expect a rebound as refreshed Model Y deliveries ramp up throughout the year. Despite declining delivery volumes, Tesla beat revenue expectations and maintained solid gross margins. In fact, gross margins increased 0.9 PP quarter-over-quarter.

title: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (July 24)
text: Shares of Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) are trading for over 4% more than a week ago, even though the electric vehicle (EV) maker posted disappointing second-quarter results and warned of rough quarters to come.

title: Tesla Posts Downbeat Earnings, Joins Community Health Systems, Chipotle Mexican Grill And Other Big Stocks Moving Lower In Thursday's Pre-Market Session
text: U.S. stock futures were mixed this morning, with the Dow futures falling around 100 points on Thursday.

title: Tesla: Robotaxis And The Balance Sheet Take Center Stage
text: Tesla's Q2 2025 report showed declining revenue and profits, with rising CAPEX. Elon Musk sounded tired, offered few details on Optimus, and emphasized robo-taxis as Tesla's future on the Q2 call. Semi, Cybertruck, and Energy segments saw reduced focus, and weak year-over-year performance in energy was surprising.

title: Tesla's darkening outlook to test robotaxi vision pushed by Musk
text: Tesla Inc.'s core car-making business is facing a deteriorating outlook, providing a major test of Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk's ability to lift the stock price with his vision of a self-driving future.

title: Nasdaq futures up but Dow Jones down as Alphabet, Tesla earnings, EU deal report eyed
text: Wall Street futures were mixed ahead of Thursday's opening bell, as investors react to mixed reports afterhours from tech giants Alphabet and Tesla, and reports of a potential trade deal between the US and the European Union. Dow Jones futures were down 0.4%, while those for the Nasdaq 100 up 0.3%, with the S&P 500 marginally above flat.

title: Musk Is Biggest Asset for Tesla, Wedbush's Ives Says
text: Dan Ives, managing director at Wedbush Securities, examines second-quarter earnings from Tesla as CEO Elon Musk warned of difficult times ahead for the company after one of its worst quarters in over a decade. -------- More on Bloomberg Television and Markets Like this video?

title: 5 Things to Know Before the Stock Market Opens
text: Stock futures are mixed in premarket trading as investors digest big Tech earnings from last night and watch for more.

title: Tesla Is Building A Fully Automated World; Why One Weak Quarter Won't Stop It
text: Tesla is a bold, long-term bet on a fully automated future, leveraging its AI-driven software and cutting-edge industrial production - both enablers of a future where humans become almost irrelevant. Despite Q2 challenges, I think Tesla's investments in AI and robotics solidify its role as a trailblazing leader in automation, with no direct US-based competitors. Tesla's vertically integrated approach and role in Musk's automation ecosystem give it a shot at a $10 trillion valuation if its vision materializes.

title: In Need Of A Growth Story At Tesla

text: Ex-Tesla Board Member Steve Westly weighs in on Elon Musk's tough quarter and what it means for the EV giant.

title: Wall Street Breakfast Podcast: Tesla Touts Ambitious Plans, Market Shrugs
text: Tesla aims to launch robotaxi service for half of U.S. by year-end, despite regulatory and production challenges. Company remains committed to affordable EV rollout in Q4, acknowledging potential rough quarters.

title: Daily stock watch: How investors are reacting to Tesla, Alphabet, and IBM's Q2 earnings
text: Tesla shares fell 6% in pre-trading after reporting a 12% revenue drop in second-quarter results. The stock rose slightly before the closing bell, before retreating on Thursday.

title: Google, Tesla Earnings Show Big Tech Winners Evolve. Why Some Are Falling Short.
text: Musk's lofty vision for robo-taxis, Google's spending on AI increases, Krispy Kreme joins the meme-stock revival, and more news to start your day.

title: Tesla shares drop 6% in premarket trading after auto sales plunge again
text: Tesla shares fell on Thursday after the company reported second-quarter automotive sales that dipped again. Musk said Tesla "probably could have a few rough quarters" ahead as a result of the expiration of federal electric vehicle tax credits.

title: Tesla faces difficult road ahead as it hopes robotaxis will offset declining sales
text: Tesla and its CEO Elon Musk are walking an increasingly difficult tightrope as the company navigates declining electric vehicle sales and an autonomous driving business that has yet to get off the ground.

title: Tesla Stock Falls. The Clock's Ticking on Robo-Taxis, Says Analyst.
text: Some analysts are skeptic on Tesla's ability to meet its robo-taxi timelines, cost targets and scale.

title: Tesla: Five reasons to be fearful
text: Tesla Inc's (NASDAQ:TSLA) latest update delivered little cheer to the market, with shares down more than 4% in after-hours trading after a second straight quarter of falling sales. Here are the five main points for those following the company from the UK: 1.

title: Tesla loses market share in Europe for sixth straight month as competition grows
text: Elon Musk's Tesla lost market share in Europe for the sixth straight month in June, according to according to the European Automobile Manufacturers Association. The figures reaffirm a downward regional trend for the U.S. electric vehicle maker.

title: Why Is Wall Street So Bearish on Tesla? There's 1 Key Reason.
text: The average Wall Street price target for Tesla (TSLA 0.19%) is currently $299.56 per share. That implies a 10% downside potential over the next 12 months.
